header: Bail application no.32/2019 Order below Exh.04 in Bail Application No.32/2019 (CNR­MHPU01­000126­2019)

background.text: 1] Applicant has filed present application for grant of ad­ interim anticipatory bail under section 438 of Cr.P.C. in respect of their apprehension of arrest in connection with CR no.270/2018 of Alankar police station under sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 of IPC.

arguments.text: 2] The applicant is practicing advocate by profession. One Geeta Bhave executed her last Will on 03/12/2016. Thereafter, she died on 12/12/2017. Advocate for applicant claims that in Registration Act 1908 there is provision to register a Will even after death of executor. As per that provision, this applicant merely identified three persons including one beneficiary of that Will and thereby assisted for registration of that Will. Applicant is permanent resident of Pune. He is professional advocate. There are no criminal antecedent against him. Considering the nature of offence and allegations, this is a fit case to grant ad­interim anticipatory bail to him. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: 2] The applicant is practicing advocate by profession.
One Geeta Bhave executed her last Will on 03/12/2016.
Advocate for applicant claims that in Registration Act 1908 there is provision to register a Will even after death of executor.
As per that provision, this applicant merely identified three persons including one beneficiary of that Will and thereby assisted for registration of that Will.
Applicant is permanent resident of Pune.
There are no criminal antecedent against him.
Considering the nature of offence and allegations, this is a fit case to grant ad­interim anticipatory bail to him.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER 1. Application (Exh.04) is allowed conditionally. 2. In the event of arrest of the applicant, he be released on ad­interim anticipatory bail in connection with CR no.270/2018 of Alankar police station under sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 of IPC, on furnishing PR bond of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen thousands 2 only) with surety of like amount. 3. He shall attend the concerned Police Station in between 10.00 a.m. to 12.00 noon on every Monday till 20/01/2019. 4. He shall not tamper with any prosecution witnesses and evidence. 5. Issue notice to the respondent as to why bail granted to him shall not be made absolute. R/o.20/01/2019. 6. This ad­interim bail shall remain valid till 20.01.2019.

footer: Sd/­ (S. S. Gosavi) Date : 03­01­2019 Additional Sessions Judge,Pune. C E R T I F I C A T E I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of steno : S. Y. Shaikh (Stenographer­Grade­I) Name of the Court : S. S. Gosavi, District Court ­ 5 & Additional Sessions Judge, Pune Date of Order : 03.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. on : 03.01.2019 Order uploaded on : 07.01.2019

Bail application no.32/2019 Order below Exh.04 in Bail Application No.32/2019 (CNR­MHPU01­000126­2019) 
---header-ends---
1] Applicant has filed present application for grant of ad­ interim anticipatory bail under section 438 of Cr.P.C. in respect of their apprehension of arrest in connection with CR no.270/2018 of Alankar police station under sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 of IPC. 
---background-ends---
2] The applicant is practicing advocate by profession. One Geeta Bhave executed her last Will on 03/12/2016. Thereafter, she died on 12/12/2017. Advocate for applicant claims that in Registration Act 1908 there is provision to register a Will even after death of executor. As per that provision, this applicant merely identified three persons including one beneficiary of that Will and thereby assisted for registration of that Will. Applicant is permanent resident of Pune. He is professional advocate. There are no criminal antecedent against him. Considering the nature of offence and allegations, this is a fit case to grant ad­interim anticipatory bail to him. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1. Application (Exh.04) is allowed conditionally. 2. In the event of arrest of the applicant, he be released on ad­interim anticipatory bail in connection with CR no.270/2018 of Alankar police station under sections 420, 465, 467, 468, 471 of IPC, on furnishing PR bond of Rs. 15,000/­ (Rs. Fifteen thousands 2 only) with surety of like amount. 3. He shall attend the concerned Police Station in between 10.00 a.m. to 12.00 noon on every Monday till 20/01/2019. 4. He shall not tamper with any prosecution witnesses and evidence. 5. Issue notice to the respondent as to why bail granted to him shall not be made absolute. R/o.20/01/2019. 6. This ad­interim bail shall remain valid till 20.01.2019. 
---order-ends---
